pull.title: [0.12 backport] script_tests improvements from master and #7818
pull.body: Assuming #7818 gets merged, here is a backport to 0.12, to unify the framework across branches.

events.message: test: Re-introduce JSON pretty printing in test builder

test: Script_error checking in script_invalid tests

Check the returned script_error. Add expected script_error
for generated as well as custom tests.

The specific error is not part of consensus, however
it could avoid unclear reporting issues such as #6862 in the future.

Fixes #7513.
Fix JSON pretty printing in script_tests

Fix some misconstructed tests

They claimed to be testing P2SH scripts with non-push scriptSigs, but
1) they were not enabling P2SH
2) they have push-only scriptSigs

Fix this, and add a few more related cases.
Fix formatting of NOPs for generated script tests
Make script_error a mandatory 4th field for script_tests
Get rid of expect in script_tests as it's implied by scripterror

rename.from: [0.12 backport] Various script_tests improvements from master and #7818
rename.to: [0.12 backport] script_tests improvements from master and #7818

events.body: I was about to ask how this integrates with "[0.12.2] qa Backports #7811" but this is different. In case anyone wonders: that pull backports functional tests, this pull backports unit tests, so there should be no overlap.

Nit: I'd prefer if you used `git cherry-pick -x $HASH` instead, so it is clear that those are backports.

Edit: I think the syntax @laanwj prefers in the commit body of the backport commit is:

```
Github-Pull: #1234
Rebased-From: aaaaaa, bbbbbb
```

Right - the idea behind those "footers" in the commit message is to be able to instantly see what pull request / master commit(s) a commit came from. The scripting to create the list of pulls in the release notes makes use of this.
